content.question: The thrust of a certain boat’s engine generates a power of <math alttext="10 kilowatts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kW</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> as the boat moves at constant speed <math alttext="10 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> through the water of a lake. The magnitude of the drag force that is exerted on the boat’s hull as it is moving through the water is directly proportional to the boat's speed and is given by the equation <math alttext="F equals k v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>v</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The increase in power needed for the boat to move through the lake at a constant speed of <math alttext="10 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>12</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
